intro: Adicea angulata, commonly known as the angular adicea, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its angular, ribbed stems and opposite leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent corona. Adicea angulata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
